Reviews.Title: Several Cameras Failed So Far - Bad Cables
Reviews.Author: Technical Reader
Reviews.Content: I have purchased a number of cameras from VideoSecu over the last year or so, and am disappointed to say this model has been troublesome. I purchased four of these for an installation at a beach house and one is giving me trouble and two others simply cannot be used. The cables for each camera end in BNC connectors and any movement or shifting of the line causes the signal to drop out. It's pretty obvious and I could not find a way to make it work for two of them. The third is in place but sporadically losing signal (I was desperate and needed something installed - I intend to replace that camera next time I am at the house).Once is mistake; three is a manufacturing defect. I bought an extra just in case something happened, but having three of four fail was too much.I have a bullet cam from this firm that is all but bullet-proof. It has survived ice, snow, wind and hurricanes. But not this model.I was on travel and cannot send these back to Amazon because I am two days over the 30-day window on returns. The manufacturer says they will send me an RMA to replace them. Will report back if there is trouble.FWIW, when these work, they work nicely. I have these tied into an Axis 4-port network server that goes into a recorder I built using ZoneMinder. Alarms cause video to be sent over the internet to my permanent home, as well as stored locally at the beach house. We had some troublesome renters that were there when I bought the beach house, and I suspected they were breaking into a second floor apartment. I tried to evict them and failed. One week after putting up cameras they gave notice and left - four months early.So I guess even a broken camera is better than no camera. It scared them enough to leave.UPDATE (January 2012):The seller never sent that promised RMA and I basically gave up chasing them. They won.One of the working cameras I installed at the time of this original review is losing signal a few times a day. This one appears to be another issue other than loose cables, because it goes gray and then kinda fades out. It is technically one of those "under warranty" things, but it's obvious the warranty is a joke to the importer and seller. They are probably the ones who labeled this review "unhelpful".Right back at ya, buddy!

Reviews.Title: Well Worth The Price !!!!!!
Reviews.Author: S.D.M.F "Bleed Black Label"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after wanting to upgrade from the camera that came as part of a eBay package deal...i was a little worried, as i really don't have too much knowledge to go on, when it comes to CCTV components, but i went along with the other reviewers and decided to give the camera a try..I have to say that i am very happy with this camera, for starters the colors are RIGHT on the money, the image is very clear, and the Nightvision is way better then i had expected, the distance that i can see is well over 40 feet...The camera is nearly unlimited as to the angles that can be set...Now i had considered the CNB line of cameras, but they are twice the price that this one cost, i have to be 100% honest and say you can't go wrong with this camera, now i just have to buy 7 more, which is gonna have to be over some time...In closing this camera is well worth what they are asking, it is Night and Day compared to what i had, previously..I am just hoping that they lower the price and then i can replace the remaining cameras much sooner...

Reviews.Title: very good quality
Reviews.Author: experienced video installer
Reviews.Content: Very good range, color balance, and well made. Instructions don't explain where to unscrew base so you're trying to remove the "ball" of the camera. You unscrew the base at the thin plate, not at the ball. 540 TVL resolution or higher is the only way to go. The wide angle lens covers a room very well but it also skews the edges (not straight). 380 and 420 TVL cameras do not have the resolution, color contrast and range. Bought 4 of these cameras - very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but LEDs have a red glow
Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: Great camera with an excellent image as the other reviews have mentioned.  I just wanted to add a note that these cameras use 850nm LEDs, which means the light they emit is invisible, but the LEDs will have a slight red glow at the tips of the LEDs.  So the camera is noticeable at night because the LEDs have a slight glow.  This is typical for most infrared LED cameras, but there are some that use 950nm LEDs which have no glow (but are more expensive as the light doesn't reach as far).

Reviews.Title: Too Soon to Have Problems
Reviews.Author: Jack of Trades
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo2202Y37SD7MQM', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo2202Y37SD7MQMloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } cv_mo2202Y37SD7MQMloadSwf_Core(swfLocation, swfWidth, swfHeight, flashVersion, bgColor, swfParams, flashParams, embedAttributes); return false; } function cv_mo2202Y37SD7MQMloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { return _cv_mo2202Y37SD7MQMloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion); } // ]]> var cv_mo2202Y37SD7MQMRollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo2202Y37SD7MQMRollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81Zli-UrAzS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; var cv_mo2202Y37SD7MQMpreplay = document.getElementById('cv_mo2202Y37SD7MQMpreplayImageId'); if (cv_mo2202Y37SD7MQMpreplay) { cv_mo2202Y37SD7MQMpreplay.onmouseover = function() { cv_mo2202Y37SD7MQMpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81Zli-UrAzS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } cv_mo2202Y37SD7MQMpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo2202Y37SD7MQMpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81Zli-UrAzS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo2202Y37SD7MQMpreplay.parentNode; var cv_mo2202Y37SD7MQMcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2202Y37SD7MQMcurrentClick) { return cv_mo2202Y37SD7MQMcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 1:10 MinsI bought this camera in early December and it worked fine for 4 "active service" months under a large weather and sun protected eave. Now, it has begun to show constant scan lines scrolling from the bottom to the top of the screen. Technically, it still functions but these types of problems usually get worse and after only 4 months of active service the camera is on a fast track to major picture deterioration. Without this recent failure, the camera picture quality was fairly good but what is good about any camera that isn't built to last (in optimal conditions no less)?Maybe I just got a bad one out of the lot but now my full return refund window is gone which means I have to uninstall the camera and have to pay to ship it back for a limited refund according to Amazon. Not a pleasant experience with this product. BTW, the three other (different brand) cameras on the system are all working fine.I gave it 2 stars because the picture quality was originally good and so was the price. Unfortunately it now feels like a "get what you paid for" item.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: 1FSTCAT
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of shopping and have had a few less expensive cameras, so far, this one has been the best bang for the buck. Excellent night time illumination at about 30 feet, wide field of view, crisp picture and color. No complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: Night Vision Unacceptable
Reviews.Author: Joshua McCown
Reviews.Content: In the daytime, the cameras work just fine and the color is decent.However at night, the infrared night vision produces a white 'halo' effect around the lens and renders the cameras useless.I've had really good success with other Videosecu dome cameras, but as others have pointed out, it looks like these are not the model to go for.  Fortunately, I'm still within my 30 day return window so I'll be looking at other options.

Reviews.Title: Dissapointing Night Vision
Reviews.Author: John Anderson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for its compact size to put near my entrance door. After comparing to another camera I have with the same 600TVL specs and price I was very disappointed. The night vision is poor at best. The day image is comparable to my other 600TVL cameras. There are other cameras out there that are better for the same price.

Reviews.Title: VideoSecu 600TVL Dome - nothing special
Reviews.Author: W. Reimers
Reviews.Content: The overall performance of this camera is no better than that of the less expensive, less lines (420), 'bullet' cameras from the same vendor.  The night vision on this model is actually worse with a weird halo around the image.  The only benefit of this camera is the unique shape, but I'll bet you can get less expensive dome cameras which I suspect will perform just as well.

Reviews.Title: Video Secu Camera 540 tvl
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: This is my first review on amazon and i had to make it because these cameras are great and i want to be the first to say that the image quality on these cameras are great. I bought these for a customer of mines who owns a clothing store and he was very pleased with the quality i used an old cp cam dvr that he was going an throw out because the quality was not good but to our surprise it was the cameras fault the pic from the dvr is superb. I used rg6 cable and compression bnc connectors also bought one of power supply boxes so i did not have any use for the adapters.... I bought 12 of these the first time and I'm already being told that i have to purchase 20 more cameras to upgrade the other clothing store that they own....... please purchase you wont regret .................................

Reviews.Title: 11 yr lead installer
Reviews.Author: Magyver
Reviews.Content: I have these and the 420 tvl... the color on the 420's seems to be better, but they are also outside.  These 600 tvl are inside and the color representation is not that great although I will say they are about 25% clearer than the 420's.  We have a brown bear and in the camera it looks baby blue.  I thought the color would be better with the Sony CCD's, but no, just clarity.  The night vision is decent, but then again, all I need is 8' and it does that no problem.  Due to the price jump from the 420 tvl, I would buy these again, but only if the price was lower.Pros: Clearer picture than the 420's, decent short range night visionCons: Color representation is horrible, long range night vision.

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality camera.. no mounting hardware
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Rebeiro
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera to replace the one that shipped with my Swann D1 DVR to place outside my door. This camera has a wider view than the standard cameras and the quality is much higher. I'm very pleased with my purchase. I'd give this camera 5 stars if it included mounting hardware (aka screws) so I didn't have to search in my garage for 4 screws to mount it.The instructions are also pretty lacking, but the camera was pretty easy to mount and adjust. You just need to unscrew the bottom ring all the way to get the mounting bracket off. You can then rotate the camera in nearly any position imaginable. Once you have it aimed properly, tighten the ring. It may help if you rotate the camera counter clockwise a bit so that when you tighten the ring, it's perfectly aligned when you have it nice and tight.I'm not quite sure why they included an AC adapter and no screws. I'd much have preferred a bnc/power cable and some screws over the AC adapter.Aside from the missing screws, this is an excellent camera. I wish I would have purchased just the DVR and then picked up a bunch of these cameras instead of using the ones that came with it. The wider view this camera provides would allow me to cover my entire property using less cameras.

Reviews.Title: Very Poor Night vision
Reviews.Author: D
Reviews.Content: Dont get if you want to see in the dark. I have this camera on one side of my house and cant see nothing when its dark(except a bright white halo). I thought maybe the leds were not on but you can seem them glowing so its not like the camera is not working. The stock cameras that came with my dvr are better, this camera is worthless.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for home or commercial use
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Jaramillo
Reviews.Content: I install cameras for a living and purchased three of these to complete an installation at a school. They are very well built and give an excellent picture. The Sony CCD chip makes all the difference. I installed all of them using professional RG-59 Cable and a wall mounted power supply. I usually get my cameras from a different dealer but thought I would try these out. Needless to say I am very satisfied and will purchase more in the future.Jeremy J

Reviews.Title: Resolution is not quality
Reviews.Author: -TMcN-
Reviews.Content: The good: Yes, it's a camera.  Probably does have the specified resolution.The bad: fish-eye distortion.  Easily washed out image.  Doesn't handle contrast well.  Mounting screws not included.The mounting is interesting; it's four pieces.  The mount that bolts to the wall, a retaining ring that screws onto that, the pivoting retainer for the ball camera, and the ball camera itself.  It is designed to mount on top of the thru-hole for the camera wire; no pre-fab flush hole for the cable.  (That would make for a BIG hole, since the BNC is attached to the camera cable.)It's worth the price, but only because the price is low.  My cheaper Swann cameras have better picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Poor night vision
Reviews.Author: Ohio Guy
Reviews.Content: I have had four cameras outside for security purposes and to keep on eye on packages being delivered. My wife wanted a better view of the front entrance so I purchased this camera too add a view.  Installation and adjustment was the sames as any other camera of ths type and not a problem.  Everything was fine that afternoon.At night, however, major disappointment.  The image was blurry and washed out. I swapped it out with another camera and the image was 100% better. Very disappointing for a camera at this price and specs.  Returned it.

Reviews.Title: The higher lines is great
Reviews.Author: RopeMan
Reviews.Content: Had a cheaper set of cameras that were almost impossible to get good images from. By using this camera as a replacement I can now get GREAT images. I also discovered that if you slow the frame rate on the recorder down to 3 frames per second at the highest resolution, you will get really sharp images. It seems that when the video recorder get overwhelmed with data at high frame rates, it throws out detail in an effort to get the image saved.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: lars "circlefreak13"
Reviews.Content: very easy to install. nice wide veiw angle and looks good at night allso. way better than the one i had over my garage before

Reviews.Title: You can't do better for twice the price
Reviews.Author: Stephen
Reviews.Content: I bought a Swann security camera system with 480 lines of resolution.  480 lines do not deliver the resolution that I wanted to see details like faces and licence plates.This camera uses a sony 1/3 inch chip instead of a 1/4 inch chip.  The resolution difference of an additional 120 lines of resolution is very noticable and far superior.I also like the Eyeball mounting bracket.  It is made from metal and very solid. It is clean looking and gives great versatility for positioning the lens.Before you go nuts when installing this camera, unscrew the locking hex nut and unscrew the base from the body.  The camera ball does not remove at this stage untill the base is removed.My only complaint is that the camera uses a wide lens.  I would have prefered a tighter image for my application

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Divekane
Reviews.Content: I bought four of these cameras because of quality of picture and price. If your looking for a good camera with good resolution, this is it. Cameras were delivered fast and packaged properly.

Reviews.Title: Can anyone help with installation of this CCTV camera?
Reviews.Author: Joyce
Reviews.Content: Hi -- I bought this camera but the directions are not very helpful. Can anyone provide step by step directions on how to install this camera? If so, I would really appreciate it! I can't get past the first step, which says to unscrew the base from the camera assembly. (To post this review, I had to rate this camera. I rated this five stars although I don't have it up yet, because I don't want to give a bad rating if it's not warranted.) Thanks very much!

Reviews.Title: no color in this camera
Reviews.Author: paul
Reviews.Content: i just got this camera and hooked it up, good 600tvl, but there is absolutely no color to this camera, unless you consider lighter shades of gray

Reviews.Title: Great quality
Reviews.Author: M. Jackson
Reviews.Content: I have three different types of CCD cameras with night vision on my property.All three are good quality.  This particular one is FAR better than the others at a fraction of the cost.Installation was easy, form factor is pleasing, and the color is VIVID.  Way better than the other cameras in contrast as well (all sony CCD internals).  This camera also performs extremely well in low light conditions and has an extremely long throw for night vision.Bottom line.....you will not be dissapointed with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera
Reviews.Author: D. Hershgold "Do It All"
Reviews.Content: I have a few of these.  They are good cameras in the daylight but the infrared emitters cast a narrow beam which reduces their field of view at night.  If you install these in an area where there is additional light, like a street light they work well.  But if the area is very dark at night and the camera is mounted far from the subject, you may need some additional IR lighting.  It's interesting the "zoom" versions of these cameras (not this one) have better field of view at night - the IR beam is wider.

Reviews.Title: 600 TVL??
Reviews.Author: Nichi
Reviews.Content: I'm no security surveillance camera expert, and am just someone who have installed 3 different set of systems for commercial and personal use.  As far as these VideoSecu 600TVL cameras go, I just don't think the color and contrast is as good as the Q-See 520 TVL cameras that I have.  But those Q-See cameras aren't dome type, meaning intruders can easily knock and damage them if they aren't installed in higher locations.Pros:good price, nicely constructed, dome typeCons:color, contrast

Reviews.Title: Lousy construction, cheap China made product.
Reviews.Author: ZechariahB
Reviews.Content: I have tested multiple cameras over a decade and these were purchased only because a customer was cheap and cheap but good was all this is.  They work, colors are nice, but adjusting these is not easy due to the way the parts fit together they don't allow them to be adjusted without having to take it nearly completely apart.  I am not sure if they are impact resistant yet but this test will be done soon.  The video quality is what is expected for the cost though.

Reviews.Title: VideoSecu 600TVL
Reviews.Author: WPB
Reviews.Content: The VideoSecu 600TVL is a great little unit for day or night security! Works great! I will add two more to my Night owl sta-84 system.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: SCOTT J NEMIRO
Reviews.Content: Easy to install. Looks professional. Could be higher quality pic but for the price and design its great. Def would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, Quality gone to crap lately.
Reviews.Author: SlipStream Electronics
Reviews.Content: I have bought well over 300 of these cameras over the last few years, and they have been good cameras. But we have been seeing a sharp drop in quality in the last 2 month, out of the last 25 cameras we have used, probably 15 had a defect in some manor, most of the time with the housing. The biggest issues we have see, is that the screw housings threads are garbage. they used to be fine. Now when you go to lock a camera down into position the outer ring does not like to thread smoothly. We generally have to use a utility knife to clean off the burs on the aluminum and also fix portions of the threads. Just today we did an 8 camera install and one of the back plates was missing the holes on it "screw mounting holes", so I had to use a step drill and drill them so we can mount it.Overall they are still ok cameras, but there quality checking has gone in the toilet.

Reviews.Title: Sharp Images
Reviews.Author: Frank J. Miller
Reviews.Content: Kinda hard to mount, if you are using the side of a pole, but the images are really sharp in the day time.Wish all my other camera's were this sharp.

Reviews.Title: Excellent 600 line camera made by Sony
Reviews.Author: David H Nielson
Reviews.Content: Sony ccd 600 line camera.  An exceptional high quality 600 line camera, picture and color is excellent.  Easy to install, excellent construction.  Well worth the investment.  Quite pleased.

Reviews.Title: ir camera
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: This is one of four cameras at my work.  Camera is 5 months old with NO problems.  Note that I am using this outdoor ir camera with an indoor (garage) application.  The case to camera is heavy / strong and will survive a strong hit.  I would buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: M. Orr
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my camera. I noticed a difference right away going to this 600 TVL camera.To those who complain about color.  You may need to adjust your settings in your DVR for brightness, contrast and etc. My cheap China DVR was able to allow me to change them for a good image. Hopefully those reviewers are aware that in night mode, the camera changes to black and white ?  (facepalm)The night IR LEDs are quite good. They light up my front porch very well.I am happy with mine, I bought a second one.

Reviews.Title: Only a Month
Reviews.Author: PApsDad
Reviews.Content: When I first received this camera I was truely impressed with this camera picture/ night vision but after a while it just went black and unable to return thrid party seller. Not Happy at all!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price. The all metal housing is tight and well built. The wide view doubled my view from my previous one. The only con to get the 4 stars is the IR, at 40 ft. it has a hot spot instead of a flood. Still a great buy.

Reviews.Title: mixed
Reviews.Author: d3tH
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for my system, which has lower tvl cameras. I wanted this for my porch for the 'vandal proof' feature. For daylight I'm not that impressed, night though, I'm shocked, it's great. I think the Lorex ones I have give a better picture in the daylight, I've tried adjusting it, to no avail.For the price, and it is vandal proof for the most part (short of spray paint or sledge hammer), it is not a bad buy. This is the first camera system I've installed, so I tried not to spend too much. Overall I am pleased with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera for a good price
Reviews.Author: Marc Gothison
Reviews.Content: We purchased two of these cameras, one for indoor use and the other, outdoor.The obvious red glow of the LEDs when in IR mode was not entirely unexpected thanks to previous reviews (effect omitted in the product description), but in retrospect, it turns out to be a positive feature that warns potential thieves off at night better than the little red sticker that was included with the camera.So far, performance is decent enough.  Camera angle-of-view is acceptable for our application, and both daytime and night picture is of good quality.  Good illumination and resolution of subjects out to six meters, then image quality starts to drop off.  We'll see if any video issues pop up like some of the other reviewers have claimed.Installation was a breeze.  It goes much better if you spray the lockring threads with a bit of all-purpose lubricant.  We added a microphone to the setup and it slips under the camera's protective cowl.  All in all, a good value (so far) and we may purchase another if we expand the system.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: Good product. Works fine and gets the job done. I spent a lot of time looking around and this is the best value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Acceptable
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: I must say that when mt husband first told me about his intention of buying this camera, I wasn't convinced that it worth the money. Now, when it is already installed on my front door, I feel more safe. It's ok having it, but we could have lived without it!

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Ed B.
Reviews.Content: I have tried several other cameras before i ended up with this model. I have to say that i really like the overall quality of these cameras. They feel and look well built and the resolution and clarity of the camera picture is so far the best of all the cameras i have hooked up to my 8 channel (CIB) DVR.I also own a black version of this same model and i like them so much that i ordered another white and black model of the same type. I'm glad they come in different 'colors' so i can try to match the outside of my house's siding better according to the positions where i place them. These are very easy to install and i like the size of them too. Not too large or too much 'in your face'. They are subtle enough for people to not notice them instantly, and noticeable enough for the people that might have bad intentions and are inspecting your house. So it's a nice little warning without your house looking like Fort Knox.The only thing i can't comment on yet is how reliable they are or how long they will last outside in different weather conditions. I know it doesn't mention anywhere that they are weatherproof but i hope they are and so far they have survived already some rainy days outside. I hope they will last through the winter too. I don't really want to buy an external dome encasing for them because that will make it look ugly and would draw way more attention than i would like to. So fingers crossed that they will last. I might edit this review after the summer or winter season to comment more about how well they survived.

ProductInfo.Features:
Built-in 1/3" Sony Super HAD CCD, color DSP image sensor
High resolution 600TV Lines. Weatherproof housing for indoor and outdoor applications
Build-in f3.6mm Lens for wide view angle, 0 Lux ( IR LED ON)
Built-in 20 LED IR illuminators for night vision
Aluminum housing; bonus power supply and bonus surveillance warning sticker included
ProductInfo.Name: VideoSecu 600TVL Built-in 1/3" SONY CCD Outdoor Dome Security Surveillance Camera Day Night Vision Vandal Proof IR Infrared 3.6mm Wide Angle Lens for Home CCTV DVR Surveillance System with Power Supply 1Z2
